title: Get started with hydroponics
description: Learn how to grow plants without soil!

dialogue.text: Hey there! I'm Hydro, your local hydroponics expert! Before you ask, it's just a nickname :P

options.text: Hydroponics? That sounds really interesting, tell me more.

dialogue.text: Oh I could talk for hours but I'll give you the short version: hydroponics is a method of growing plants using mineral nutrient solutions in water, without soil. It's a great way to save resources and space while ensuring a constant supply of fresh produce during your space adventures. Unless you're growing outside, you'll definitely incur a bit of energy costs from indoor lighting, but on the flip side you can save up to 95% on your water usage compared to traditional farming. I've got a hydroponics tub for you to get started if you're interested.

options.text: That sounds amazing! Let's get started.

dialogue.text: Excellent! First things first, I need you to accept this hydroponics tub. It's all set up, you just need to add water and the plant seeds to get started.

options.text: I've got the hydroponics tub, what's next?

dialogue.text: Now that you've got your hydroponics tub, you'll need some dechlorinated water. There are a few techniques to accomplish this, but the simplest and cheapest way is to just let tap water sit outdoors for 48 hours or so. Here, take this sink! And then let that sink in üòÅ

options.text: Ha, very funny. I know just where to put this.
Kind of weird that I didn't have one of those already.

dialogue.text: I know, right? It's almost like the gamedev is awkwardly reusing existing game systems instead of building a proper one! But I digress. Now that you've got your sink installed, why don't you fill a bucket up with water? I'll show you how, if you need...

options.text: No, I think I've got this one, thanks!
Alright, I've completed the challenging task of filling a bucket with water. What's next?

dialogue.text: Next you dechlorinate, of course! You may have to scoop some bugs out after, but this is a decent way to ensure there's no chlorine. Just make sure it gets direct sunlight!

options.text: My water should be good to go now, right?

dialogue.text: Yup! Next up, we've gotta make some seedlings! And what better way than with seeds? You gotta soak some rockwool in water for like 15 minutes or so. That way the water's fully permeated them! Rockwool is a great growing medium for hydroponics.

options.text: I can add the seeds now, right?

dialogue.text: You sure can! Just plop a few seeds in each pre-drilled hole. Afterwards you can just leave them in a window for a few weeks and come back when they've grown into little baby seedlings!

options.text: I can add the seeds now, right?
